Description: Fragment of a beige plaster jar-sealing. The outer convex surface bears a vertical cartouche of the king Amasis stamped in low relief, surmounted by a solar disc between two ostrich feathers. The inner concave surface shows negative impression of the rim of the jar and traces of another layer of a white plaster.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18.
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 18 has been scratched into the inner surface. Being studied as part of PhD by Elisabeth Greifenstein (University of Wuerzburg).
Bibliographic references: Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (2787, p. 292)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 72 § 69)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.69, p.183, pl.25)
